Top-3 Similar Questions: so_67683870: Count lines of code recursively, including compressed (zip) files
Top-3 Scripts:
so_67683870: unzip -p archive.zip file1 file2 ...

unzip -p archive.zip '*.java'

Explanations about Options.-p:
extract files to pipe (stdout). Nothing but the file data is sent to stdout , and
 the files are always extracted in binary format, just as they are stored (no
 conversions).

ul_245856: Zip a file without including the parent directory
so_3630167: Zip command without including the compressed dir itself
Top-3 Scripts:
ul_245856: zip -j folder/artifact.zip folder/artifact1.app folder/artifact2.ext2 folder/artifact3.ext3

zip -j folder/{artifact.zip,artifact1.app,artifact2.ext2,artifact3.ext3}

(cd folder && zip artifact.zip artifact1.app artifact2.ext2 artifact3.ext3)

pushd folder
zip artifact.zip artifact1.app artifact2.ext2 artifact3.ext3
popd

so_3630167: cd folder1 && zip -r ../bar.zip *

bsdtar cf bar.zip --format zip -C folder1 .

Explanations about Options.-j:
Store just the name of a saved file (junk the path), and do not store directory
 names. By default, zip will store the full path (relative to the current
 directory).

Explanations about Options.-C: [VMS] Preserve case all on VMS. Negating this option (-C-) downcases.
